The lack of guns could lead to a decrease in violent crime rates and an increase in positive social interactions.
Disappearing guns may also cause people to rely more on law enforcement or seek alternative solutions to protect themselves and their homes.
In a world without guns, it may lead to a shift in societal norms surrounding self-defense and security.
People might turn to alternative ways of dealing with personal disputes, such as mediation or counseling.
Without guns, some people may turn to lethal force substitutes, like batarangs or grappling hooks as alternatives.
